title: Police release sketch in search for baby killer
content:
DETROIT - Police are seeking help identifying a man they suspect shot and killed a 6-month-old girl on Detroit's west side Saturday.
A sketch of the suspect was released Thursday.
Two people of interest in the investigation were initially taken into custody, but later released.
A third person believed to have been in the vehicle from which the gunfire came is still being sought.
Detroit police believe the shooting was gang-related, possibly retaliation for the Easter morning killing of 3-year-old A'Naiya Montgomery.
Three men were charged with murder in that case.
The possibly retaliatory Saturday gunfire killed 6-month-old Miracle Murray and injured a 24-year-old man. The shooting occurred in the 18000 block of Winthrop, which some neighbors described as typically a "quiet spot, nice and peaceful."
On Monday afternoon, children in shorts ran and smiled in the yard across from where 6-month-old Miracle Murray died after being shot in the back Saturday.
If anyone has seen these individual, knows of his whereabouts, or have any information pertaining to this crime please call Homicide at (313) 596-2260, or contact CRIMESTOPPERS at 1-800-SPEAK UP.
Ian Thibodeau is the business and development reporter for MLive Media Group in Detroit. He can be reached at ithibode@mlive.com, or follow him on Twitter.
